task.title: Mirror in 3D
task.shortdesc: You can create a mirror image of selected objects in three-dimensional space. You mirror the objects about a mirror plane that you define by either specifying three points; selecting an existing two- dimensionalplanar object; aligning the plane parallel with the xy, yz, or xz plane of the current UCS; or aligning the plane with the current view. You can delete or retain the original objects.

context.p: To mirror an object about a three-dimensionalplane

step.cmd: Choose Modify > 3D Operation > 3D Mirror from the main menu.
Select the objects, and then press Enter.
At command line prompt, choose 3points, or press Enter to select the default.
Specify the first point on the mirror plane.
Specify the second and third points on the plane.
At command line prompt, choose one of the following:

result.p: Left: Select the object to mirror (A), and then specify the first point (B), the second point (C), and third point (D) defining the mirror plane
